newsitem.title: INDIA: India's L&T says projects fully-funded.
newsitem.headline: India's L&T says projects fully-funded.

text.p: Engineering firm Larsen & Toubro Ltd (L&T), one of India's leading private sector firms, said on Thursday it had completed funding of all its major projects until the end of calendar 1998.

"We have two cement plants under construction - the Gujarat plant has almost completed expansion," Yeshwant Deosthalee, L&T's senior vice president (finance) and member of the board, told Reuters in an interview.
Other major projects in hand include two captive power plants, he said. The funds requirement for these projects would be about 15.0 billion rupees ($418 million), he said.
"All these projects are substantially funded," he said.
He said if L&T decides to expand the capacity of its proposed 1.7 million tonnes a year cement plant at Tadpatri in the southern Andhra Pradesh state, it may have to raise fresh funds.
Deosthalee said L&T's debt equity ratio was very conservative at less than one to one. "It could be 0.75 to one by the year-end," he said.
